intro: Faxonanthus pringlei, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Faxonanthus pringlei is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is an important part of the local ecosystem.
